name: NYDailyNews
text:
Saudi consulate workers were told to stay away on the day Jamal Khashoggi disappeared, witnesses said as the murder trial of 20 alleged conspirators began.

“There was an atmosphere of panic,” one witness recalled.
https://t.co/ftMCF4T53L

name: NYDailyNews
text:
A man trying to break up a fight between a man and two teenage girls was killed after being pushed into a Harlem subway train.

The man fell between two cars as the train was still moving, pinning his head and arm to the platform.
https://t.co/XRzrbEp2m6

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Renowned documentary filmmaker Kevin Rafferty of "The Atomic Cafe" has died at 73.

Rafferty, who was battling cancer, produce documentaries one various topics, from cigarettes to politics to American hate groups from the K.K.K. to the American Nazi Party.
https://t.co/Ol1tyxjTwC

name: NYDailyNews
text:
The words "racist fish" were scrawled on a Little Mermaid statue in Copenhagen.

The Little Mermaid statue, one of’s that nation’s most iconic attractions, was tagged at its pedestal.
https://t.co/v7JhifCkKO

name: NYDailyNews
text:
The Yankees' Zack Britton is ready to focus on pitching after baseball’s labor fight.

"I think the best thing for us moving forward as players and the game in general and the owners, is just getting back to playing baseball," Britton said.
https://t.co/3lm5xB0Rgz

name: NYDailyNews
NYDailyNews
text:
Refinery29 is getting a makeover, starting from the top.

The women’s media site has lost yet another leader.
https://t.co/8HFzJUf07Y

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Even in a crisis, it’s good to stop and smell the roses.

At least that’s how Caroline Anderson sees it. The former art gallery director turned her love of lilies and lavender into a nonprofit flower distribution service called BloomAgainBklyn.
https://t.co/UfAIf0prk8
